data.title: Add Linux tarball creation to build/release scripts
data.body: @didrocks made the changes to create it but we're not yet publishing it with releases, which we should. Relevant PR is #9554.

data.title: CRTL+F4 should close tab
data.body:
Atom partly follows browser tab handling (e.g. CRTL+SHIFT+T to re-open the last closed tab).

It should also implement the usual browser shortcut for closing a tab (CTRl+F4) (whether instead of CTRL+W as is presently the case or additionally I have no opinion).

This regularly trips me up, as I'm used to this shortcut from both any desktop browser I've ever used and quite a few applications which implement a multi-document interface.

data.title: Not starting: TypeError: Cannot read property 'fromFetchhead' of undefined
data.body:

Atom doesn't start properly providing Chrome's development tools instead.
STDOUT/ERR output follows:

```
[32209:0415/171027:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(203)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.

App load time: 588ms

    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/git-repository-provider.js:8:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/git-repository-provider.js:83:4)
    at Module._compile (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:103:30)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)

    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
```


I've tried all binary releases downwards and **first that worked** was `1.5.4`.


data.title: Atom 1.7: bad scrollbar behavior
data.body:
Windows 7, Atom 1.7.1 started in safe mode.

I load a medium-sized file, around 500 lines of JS code.
I jump to the end of the file with Ctrl+End.

The scrollbar thumb isn't at the bottom of the scrollbar.
I try to click on the middle of the thumb (to drag it). The thumb goes up. I can repeat this a few times, until the thumb goes in the first half of the bar. There, I can catch it...

Actually, I can drag the thumb if I aim at where it should be (the bottom of the bar).

data.title: Reloading wipes undo history and scroll position
data.body:
Prior to v1.7.0, it was possible to undo changes to an opened document after reloading the window (as long as it'd been running in development mode). I always assumed this was a feature of dev mode... make changes to a package repo, reload window, see what's wrong, undo last change, repeat.

Since upgrading to v1.7.0, I'm no longer able to do this. I'm unsure if this is by design or just an honest bug (or even if the previous behaviour was a bug to begin with...)

Also, the scroll offset isn't preserved after reloading the window: it reverts back to the top of the document. This wasn't the case before.

For the record, I'm using the _Reload window_ command from the _View -> Developer_ menu (which I've assigned the keyboard shortcut of <kbd>⌘ + shift + R</kbd>).

data.title: [linux] Atom 1.7.x fails on startup
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When starting atom (does not matter if with `atom` or with `atom --safe`) I get the following error message:

```
index.js:62
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 47, got 46.
    at Error (native)
    at process.module.(anonymous function) [as dlopen] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:159:20)
    at Object.Module._extensions..node (module.js:450:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:170:18)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:50:27)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/nodegit/lib/nodegit.js:9:12)
    at Module._compile (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:103:30)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:50:27)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/git-repository-async.js:25:16)
    at Module._compile (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:103:30)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:50:27)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/git-repository.js:12:24)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/git-repository.js:428:4)
    at Module._compile (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:103:30)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (/…/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/native-compile-cache.js:50:27)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Build atom:
   
   ```
   $ git fetch -p --all
   $ git checkout $(git tag --sort="version:refname" | grep -v -E "alpha|beta" | tail -n 1)
   $ script/build
   $ script/grunt install --install-dir /…/atom-install
   $ /…/atom-install/bin/apm update
   ```
   
   (/…/atom-install/ is empty before starting grunt)
2. Remove atom config from home:
   
   ```
   mv ~/.atom ~/.atom-backup
   ```
3. Start atom:
   
   ```
   atom --safe
   ```
4. Clean 
   
   ```
   rm -rf /…/atom-install/*
   ```
5. Repeat steps 1. to 3., but now checkout version 1.6.2 in step 1. → Atom starts as expected.

**Expected behavior:** Atom starts like in versions <= 1.6.x

**Actual behavior:** See Description (fails since 1.7.0)
### Versions

I'm running on Debian Stretch aka testing.  Here is some more detailed information:

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.1
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$ apm --version
apm  1.9.2                                                                                  
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1+
git 2.8.0.rc3

$ uname -a
Linux x250 4.4.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.4.6-1 (2016-03-17) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

data.title: Atom open files as empty and no git integration
data.body:
Hello,

Since i've upgraded from Atom 1.5.4 to the latest 1.7.1 on my mac i can't use it anymore.
All files that i open from my project are empty. Even more strange i get no git integration (no branch name).
I tried the safe mode but get the same result.

I tried with severals version and it first appear on the 1.6.0 version.
Downgrading to the 1.5.4 solved my problem but i would like to try the latests features.

I'm using a mounting point (sshfs) but ii doesn't seems to be the problem as i'm able to get the file content from another editor. 

Any ideas of where does it come from ?

data.title: Unable to open a new window from command line when atom is already running
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

I spend a lot of time in CLI and I also open editors from there all the time. I've recently came back to atom, I updated it to 1.7.0 (now to 1.7.1) and opened atom in the current directory by `atom .`. This works correctly. But when I want to open another window in different directory `atom .` doesn't work anymore. I also tried the new `atom -a .` command and it doesn't work either.

I realised that `atom .` command works only when the editor is completely closed. Only when there is no instance running, I'm able to open it from CLI. But when it's already running, I'm unable to open a new window, or add it as a project to existing one.

To be precise, it looks like something happens there, atom starts opening, but then it quits. Atom just blinks in menu bar for a few ms and then disappears.

I also tried this with the recent beta. I found an error that happens there. When I open beta in CLI like this `$ /Applications/Atom\ Beta.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom`, the atom opens:

```
$ /Applications/Atom\ Beta.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom
2016-04-15 11:36:48.812 Atom[92173:6330910] App load time: 289ms
```

Then when I try to open a new window with `atom-beta .`, I see this error in beta log:

```
2016-04-15 11:38:38.176 Atom[92173:6330910] Unexpected end of input
2016-04-15 11:38:38.183 Atom[92173:6330910] SyntaxError: Unexpected end of input
    at Object.parse (native)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:244:28)
    at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:169:7)
    at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:146:16)
    at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:110:10)
    at Pipe.onread (net.js:523:20)
2016-04-15 11:38:38.184 Atom[92173:6330910] Unexpected token .
2016-04-15 11:38:38.185 Atom[92173:6330910] SyntaxError: Unexpected token .
    at Object.parse (native)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:244:28)
    at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:169:7)
    at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:146:16)
    at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:110:10)
    at Pipe.onread (net.js:523:20)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open atom (doesn't matter if via CLI, or normally)
2. When atom is running, go to CLI and try to open atom with `atom .`

**Expected behavior:** I would expect new window to opened.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens.
### Versions

OS X: 10.11.4

Atom    : 1.7.1
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.4.4

I've also tried it on beta with no luck either:

Atom    : 1.8.0-beta1
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Update Electron to 0.37
data.body:
Naïve bump to Electron 37 to see what broke and what got fixed.

~~Blocked on #11348~~
### TODO:
- [x] ~~Fix background throttling~~ (`text-editor-component-spec.coffee` fails even if we disable throttling, which means those specs need to be revamped because they're too time sensitive)
- [x] Fix autocomplete-plus specs (bb46933)
- [x] Fix find-and-replace specs (bb46933)
- [x] Fix tree-view specs (atom/tree-view#649)
- [x] Fix subpixel AA on non-editor elements
- [x] Test for regressions

Closes #6320
Unblocks atom/atom-keymap#35
If anyone knows of any other issues that are resolved with the upgrade to 0.37 please let me know!

/cc @lee-dohm

data.title: Allow autoIndent when inserting single new line `selection.insertText("\n", {autoIndent: true}).
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

/cc @kuychaco 

Before v1.7.0 or more specifically before #10878, `selection.insertText("\n", {autoIndent: true})` auto-indented.
The change in this PR added `NonWhitespaceRegExp.test(text)` check, which return `false` for "\n", that result in `autoIndentFirstLine` never be `true`.
Is this intended, necessary change?

I need to autoIndent when inserting single new line in my vim-mode-plus so I have to workaround by manually emulating auto indent when inserting single "\n"
t9md/atom-vim-mode-plus#231
### Steps to Reproduce

in Atom v1.6.0

`selection.insertText("\n", autoIndent: true)` do auto-indent

in Atom v1.7.0
`selection.insertText("\n", autoIndent: true)` don't auto-indent

I want to autoIndend when inserting single new line like it was in v1.6.0.

data.title: After auto-update, Atom reopens with multiple Untitled tabs
data.body:
### Description

On two different OSX versions (10.11.4 and 10.9.5), the upgrade to 1.7.0 relaunched Atom with my multiple open documents replaced with Untitled empty tabs. This did cause some loss of work (my fault, obviously, but still a nasty surprise).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Restart Atom to install the 1.7.0 update with multiple files open

**Expected behavior:** 
Atom 1.7.0 would finish the install and re-open with the same files open in tabs

**Actual behavior:**
All open docs were replaced by empty Untitled tabs - for unsaved docs, this was fatal.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Reporting this from my OSX 10.9.5 box:

```
[12:12:17] tnboyd:~ $ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
[12:12:22] tnboyd:~ $ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.1
```

data.title: Electron 0.36 broke stdout on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? (I think...)
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

It seems that the version of Electron bundled in Atom fails to report any data back on `stdout` when called as Node. `options.env.ELETRON_RUN_AS_NODE` is set (to `1`), but the `stdout` callbacks are never called. If you have Node installed on the machine and replace `process.execPath` with the path to Node everything works as expected (tested with Node v5.9.0).

This has been reported as an issue by users updating to v1.7.0 on the following linter plugins:
- `linter-jshint`
- `linter-htmlhint`
- `linter-csslint`
- Possibly `linter-bootlint` as well (Looks like this might just be user error)

Note that none of those linters have AppVeyor (Windows) CI testing configured.

The following Node based linters _are_ being tested on AppVeyor, but it turns out all of these are directly being `require`'d, and as such aren't being ran as an "external" Node process:
- linter-stylelint
- linter-js-yaml

`linter-eslint` is interesting in that it _is_ working, but it utilizes a worker process that is being created with [`child_process.fork()`](https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-eslint/blob/v7.2.0/src/helpers.js#L15).

This _might_ be a duplicate of https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2887, is probably caused by https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9627, and might be related to https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11162.

If there is any further information or debugging information that would help please let me know. I'm almost always available as @arcanemagus on Atom's Slack instance if anything is needed.

@50Wliu, @joshaber, @joefitzgerald I'm tagging you three as it seems you have all worked on parts of the Electron update and might know more about how to further test this.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom v1.7.0 or above
2. Use something that attempts to load a Node process (ie: BufferedNodeProcess, or more indirectly  [linter-jshint](https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-jshint))
3. Observe that the `stdout` callbacks are never called

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Calling a Node process works as expected

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The `stdout` callback is never called, so the process `stdout` never gets any data.
### Versions

OS: Windows 7 - 10
Atom: v1.7.0 - v1.8.0-beta0

Atom v1.8.0-beta0:

``` raw
Atom    : 1.8.0-beta0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: single clicking files in tree view no longer opens them after updating to 1.7
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ✔️ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ✔️ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ✔️ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ✔️ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ✔️ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ✔️ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

if "allow pending pane items" is disabled, single clicking a file in tree view no longer does anything after updating to 1.7

In 1.6 single clicking a file would open it permanently in a new pane if "allow pending pane items" was disabled.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. disable "allow pending pane items"
2. single-click a file in tree view

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Single-clicking a file in tree view should open the file in a new, permanent pane if "allow pending pane items" is disabled.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Nothing. Files only open if double-clicked.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4

data.title: Atom 1.7 win10 Crash and couldn't be started
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom stopped responding and answering after I tried the search in directory of the project. Then it couldn't be started and returned an error during the start. Running of the installer on top that installation didn't help.

I managed to get rid of this error by starting the second instance of atom with `atom --safe`
while the one problematic was opened, then closed the problematic one first. Now Atom could be restarted without this crash, but I've lost all unsaved changes in files and project structure, so I think that the problem might be somewhere in user-session parameters
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Run search in the directory
2. Search hangs
3. Atom stop responding and show crash error after restart
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 2.7.4.windows.1
visual studio
```

windows 10 home

data.title: Syntax highlighting JavaScript not working when using block comments in a string
data.body:
### Description

The syntax highlighting of JavaScript does seem to have a problem when using block comments in a string as reproducible in the following simple example:

``` javascript
/*
const files = glob.sync('src/**/*.+(gif|png|jpg|ico)');
*/
```
### Versions

1.7.0

data.title: Long links line-breaking could be improved
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Long "words" (in this case links) break to a new line if they follow some text, even if they will anyways cover more than the editor are and therefore will need to be broken again. In the provided example, it is obvoius that it would be better to leave the link on the original line and break it in half. 

![Image describing the bad line breaking.](http://i.imgur.com/mjR0hI1.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Enable "Soft Wrap at Prefereed Line Length"
2. Write some text that covers about 1/3 of the preferred line length
3. Paste a link that is longer than the preferred line length

**Expected behavior:** Link to follow after the written text, be broken at an appropriate place, and continue on the next line

**Actual behavior:** Link moves directly to the next line, is broken after `preferred line length` characters, and continues on the line below that, just as the image describes.
### Versions

Atom 1.7.0
Windows 10

data.title: Functions are inconsistently highlighted
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

**Functions in code are inconsistently highlighted:**
- Functions _not_ in standard library:

![Functions not in standard library are not highlighted](http://i.imgur.com/LtGDezUl.png)
- Functions in standard library:

![Functions in standard library are highlighted blue](http://i.imgur.com/RrZxWEm.png)
- Functions _not_ in standard library _being defined_:

![Functions not in standard library while defining are highlighted blue](http://i.imgur.com/iV5gGz0.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Write functions
2. Call them
3. See how they are not highlighted at all

**Expected behavior:** 

All functions, during definition and calling, should be highlighted.

**Actual behavior:** 

Only standard library functions are highlighted.
### Versions
- OS: Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit
- Atom version: 1.7

data.title: Disable new tab switching behaviour (Atom 1.7.0)
data.body:
Atom Updated to v1.7.0 today and has broken tab switching. It seems to go to the most recently used file - which is unpredictable. When I press CTRL+TAB I expect to go to the next tab - not to any random tab that I may have used last without any visual clue. 

How do I turn that off and go back to the old behaviour?

Fedora 22 and atom 1.7

data.title: Different process.env.PATH variable between platforms v1.7.0
data.body:
This issue is related with [PlatformIO IDE](http://platformio.org/platformio-ide) and https://github.com/platformio/platformio-atom-ide/issues/94. 
Environment variable `PATH` is removed/missed from `process.env` dictionary under Windows. Now (>=Atom 1.7.0), we have a difference between Windows and Unix where `PATH` is available under Unix platforms and `Path` for Windows.

Is this an issue or "feature"? thanks.

**Expected behavior:** `process.env.PATH` should work everywhere.

**Actual behavior:** We have different variables per platform.
### Versions

Atom 1.7.0
### Dump


data.title: Fix deprecations reporting
data.body:
Previously builds that contained deprecations were failing without logging out the reason. I tracked down the issue to `ELECTRON_ENABLE_LOGGING`, which was preventing deprecations from being logged out. This is how this PR changes the `run-specs` task to handle this scenario correctly:
1. :bug: Use `ELECTRON_ENABLE_LOGGING=true`. This allows us to capture the output of calls to `console.warn` and `console.log`, which are useful to log out Grim deprecations.
2. :fire: Remove calls to `logDeprecations`. This method used to format the output captured in `stderr` to strip out "[Console]" noise from deprecations. This code path was not running anymore because we started using `stdio: 'inherit'` in #10838 for core specs, which prevents stderr output to be captured. I feel like it's okay to remove it, as the output is already readable as it is.

You can see a sample of a new build here: https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/jobs/123049543#L254-L257.

data.title: Strange Problem
data.body:
### Description

Adding just one line in file modifies other lines even when we don't touch other lines.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open this file in Atom : https://github.com/udacity/create-your-own-adventure/blob/master/language.md
2. Append newline at the end.
3. Save and run 'git diff'

**Expected behavior:** 
I expected only a new line to be added.

**Actual behavior:**
Other lines get modified.
### Versions

1.6.2
### How did I solve?

I added the line using Vim and it worked perfectly.
